metadata.feature_description: Extracts searchable content from documents using IFilter providers for PDF and Office files.

steps.action: Navigate to Site Settings > Search > File Extensions tab
steps.expected: File Extensions tab shows list of included and excluded file extensions with IFilter status
steps.actual: File Extensions tab displayed correctly showing included extensions (.doc, .docx, .pdf, .ppt, .pptx, .txt, .xls) with IFilter provider information

test_scenarios.scenario_name: IFilter Availability Detection for Word Documents (.doc)

steps.action: View .doc extension in File Extensions list
steps.expected: System shows IFilter provider name for .doc files
steps.actual: Microsoft Office Filter displayed for .doc extension with checkmark icon indicating content crawling is available

test_scenarios.scenario_name: IFilter Availability Detection for Word Documents (.docx)

steps.action: View .docx extension in File Extensions list
steps.expected: System shows IFilter provider name for .docx files
steps.actual: Wordpad DOCX Filter displayed for .docx extension with checkmark icon indicating content crawling is available

test_scenarios.scenario_name: IFilter Availability Detection for PDF Files

steps.action: View .pdf extension in File Extensions list
steps.expected: System shows IFilter status for .pdf files
steps.actual: PDF extension shows info icon indicating 'Content crawling is unavailable' - correctly detecting that no PDF IFilter is installed on the test system

steps.action: View .ppt extension in File Extensions list
steps.expected: System shows IFilter provider name for .ppt files
steps.actual: Microsoft Office Filter displayed for .ppt extension with checkmark icon indicating content crawling is available

steps.action: View .pptx extension in File Extensions list
steps.expected: System shows IFilter status for .pptx files
steps.actual: PPTX extension shows info icon indicating 'Content crawling is unavailable' - correctly detecting that no PPTX IFilter is installed on the test system

steps.action: View .xls extension in File Extensions list
steps.expected: System shows IFilter provider name for .xls files
steps.actual: Microsoft Office Filter displayed for .xls extension with checkmark icon indicating content crawling is available

test_scenarios.scenario_name: IFilter Availability Detection for Text Files (.txt)

steps.action: View .txt extension in File Extensions list
steps.expected: System shows IFilter provider name for .txt files
steps.actual: Plain Text filter displayed for .txt extension with checkmark icon indicating content crawling is available
Add file extension form appeared with text input field and Save/Cancel buttons

steps.expected: New extension is added to the list with IFilter status
steps.actual: Extension .xlsx was added successfully to the included extensions list with info icon showing 'Content crawling is unavailable' (no xlsx IFilter installed)
Confirmation dialog appeared asking 'Are you sure you want to delete .xlsx?' with Yes/No buttons

steps.expected: Extension is removed from the list
steps.actual: Extension .xlsx was successfully removed from the included extensions list

steps.action: Attempt to add .pdf extension which already exists
steps.actual: System displayed error notification indicating the extension already exists (AlreadyInList)

steps.action: View Excluded File Extensions section in File Extensions tab
steps.expected: List of excluded extensions is displayed
Crawling tab shows directory configuration options
steps.actual: Crawling tab displayed with URL Paths, Duplicates patterns, Included Directories (Images/), and Excluded Directories sections

steps.action: Click Add Directory for Included Directories
steps.actual: Directory picker dialog appeared showing folder tree (Site Root, Badges, Groups, Images, RenamedSecureFolder, Templates, Users)

observations: IFilter provider detection works correctly - shows provider name (e.g., 'Microsoft Office Filter', 'Wordpad DOCX Filter', 'Plain Text filter') when IFilter is available, and info icon with 'Content crawling is unavailable' message when no IFilter is installed
Code review shows dedicated DocxToText.cs class for .docx file extraction that doesn't rely on IFilter, using XML parsing instead
FilterLoader.cs correctly uses Windows registry to detect IFilter providers at HKLM\Software\Classes\CLSID for different file extensions
IFilterDocumentIndexer.cs handles text file size limitation (default 25MB) with configurable sc_MaxTextFilterBytes host setting
Directory picker UI had some interaction issues with overlapping elements, but the feature is present and displays correctly
The system requires Windows IFilter Components to be installed for full document content extraction capabilities
